JSRDotNETSDK Reference

JSRDotNET Members

JSRDotNET Class  Constructors  Events  Methods  Fields  Properties  See Also

Main interface for accessing a Jsr Pulser Receiver product family from a DLL.

The following tables list the members exposed by the JSRDotNET type.

Constructors
Name Description
JSRDotNET Specialised default constructor for use only by derived class.
Top
Properties
Name Description
InstrumentDiscoveryEnable When true, this instance of the DLL will fire InstrumentDiscovered events when an instrument which matches the instrument open filter is discovered. Instruments which are already connected at the time this event is set to true will generate InstrumentDiscoveredEvents immediately after this property is set. Usb devices which are connected later time will also generate InstrumentDiscoveredEvents when they are plugged in as long as this property is true. This property can be set to true and left alone, or it can be set back to false to prevent the discovery of more instruments. When set back to the true state, any devices which were attached but were prevented from discovery will then fire discovery events.
InstrumentIdentities Gets an array with the list of all discovered instrument identities.
InstrumentOpenCriteria Optional Specifier to express interest in only one particular model or unit specified by serialnumber.
PluginName Gets the name of the plugin.
TimeoutMSec Gets or sets the timeout of how to long to wait for the instrument to respond to a request for a property or function. If the timeout is exceeded, an exception is thrown.
Top
Methods
Name Description
Configure Configures.
Equals (Overloaded) Determines whether the specified Object is equal to the current Object. (inherited from Object).
Finalize Allows an Object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the Object is reclaimed by garbage collection. (inherited from Object).
GetEarliestLogLine Gets earliest log line.
GetHashCode Serves as a hash function for a particular type. (inherited from Object).
GetInstrumentIdentity Gets an array with the list of all discovered instrument identities.
GetLogLineCount Gets log line count.
GetPulserReceiver Given a pulser receiver id, this returns a reference to a pulser receiver object.
GetPulserReceivers (Overloaded) Gets an array of pulser receiver Ids that are within the specified instrument. Alternatively, there is an overload of this method which takes the model number an serial number string as arguments instead of this instrumend identity object. Normally, the application will get the instrument ID object from the InstrumentDiscoveredEvent handler.
GetType (Overloaded) Gets the Type of the current instance. (inherited from Object).
MemberwiseClone Creates a shallow copy of the current Object. (inherited from Object).
ReferenceEquals Determines whether the specified Object instances are the same instance. (inherited from Object).
Reset Resets this module so it can be reconfigured. The Open Options should be set again after calling this function and Discovery can be re-enabled. Not all plugins support this feature, so check the return code from this function to determine if the plugin instance can be re-used.
Shutdown Shuts down this module by stopping any threads and freeing any resources it is using. This must be done before the application exits to avoid hangs at exit time.
ToString Returns a String that represents the current Object. (inherited from Object).
doShutdown Tells the JSRDotNET subclass implementor to perform the shutdown.
enableInstrumentDiscovery When true, this instance of the DLL will fire InstrumentDiscovered events when an instrument which matches the instrument open filter is discovered. Instruments which are already connected at the time this event is set to true will generate InstrumentDiscoveredEvents immediately after this property is set. Usb devices which are connected later time will also generate InstrumentDiscoveredEvents when they are plugged in as long as this property is true. This property can be set to true and left alone, or it can be set back to false to prevent the discovery of more instruments. When set back to the true state, any devices which were attached but were prevented from discovery will then fire discovery events.
fireDiscoveryCompleteEvent Raises the discovery complete event.
fireDiscoveryStartedEvent Raises the discovery started event.
fireExceptionDiscoveryEvent Raises the exception discovery event.
fireInstrumentDiscoveredEvent Raises the instrument discovered event.
sendEvent Sends an event to the registered event handlers
Top
Events
Name Description
InstrumentDiscoveredEventHandler Event queue for listeners interested in InstrumentDiscoveredEventHandler events. This is called once for each instrument which is discovered while InstrumentDiscoveryEnable is true.
